metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5387 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Apache HTTP Server through 2.4.23 follows RFC 3875 section 4.1.18 and therefore does not protect applications from the presence of untrusted client data in the HTTP_PROXY environment variable, which might allow remote attackers to redirect an application's outbound HTTP traffic to an arbitrary proxy server via a crafted Proxy header in an HTTP request, aka an "httpoxy" issue.  NOTE: the vendor states "This mitigation has been assigned the identifier CVE-2016-5387"; in other words, this is not a CVE ID for a vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.1').
